means: [人名] [南方英格兰人姓氏] 萨利可能是住所名称，来源于古诺斯语，含义是“裂开的+岛”(cleft+island)

sentence.Network_en: I felt loath to sully the gleaming brass knocker by handling it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不愿意伸手去抓那闪亮的黄铜门环，怕把它弄脏。

sentence.Network_en: I wouldn't sully my hands by acceptinga bribe.
sentence.Network_cn: 我决不接受贿赂,一尘不染.
萨利有一个凸出的高鼻子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: perhaps from French souiller 'to soil'

entry.def: If something is sullied by something else, it is damaged so that it is no longer pure or of such high value.

example.ex: The City's reputation has been sullied by scandals like those at Lloyd's...
example.tran: 类似劳埃德保险公司的那些丑闻令伦敦名声扫地。

example.ex: She claimed they were sullying her good name.
example.tran: 她声称他们在败坏她的名誉。

entry.def: If someone sullies something, they make it dirty.

example.ex: I felt loath to sully the gleaming brass knocker by handling it.
example.tran: 我不愿意伸手去抓那闪亮的黄铜门环，怕把它弄脏。

means.word_mean: 1. place under suspicion or cast doubt upon;
2. make dirty or spotty, as by exposure to air; also used metaphorically;

sentences.sentence: "The silver was tarnished by the long exposure to the air"
"Her reputation was sullied after the affair with a married man"

means.word_mean: 3. charge falsely or with malicious intent; attack the good name and reputation of someone;

sentences.sentence: "The journalists have defamed me!" "The article in the paper sullied my reputation"

auth_sentence.content: There was nothing, no flaw, to sully the picture.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was nothing, no flaw, to sully the picture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was nothing, no flaw, to sully the picture.

auth_sentence.content: Del Toro does not worry that such fancies will sully his reputation.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Del Toro does not worry that such fancies will sully his reputation.

auth_sentence.content: Though the guitarist does his best to sully matters by noodling all over the top of it.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Though the guitarist does his best to sully matters by noodling all over the top of it.

sentences.en: Her reputation is sullied by crimes.
sentences.cn: 她的名誉被许多罪行所玷污。
